auth.twoFactorTitle: Please enter the authentication code from your authenticator app.
auth.twoFactorNote: Note: if you don't have access to your authenticator device, you can reset your 2FA with a recovery code by logging in via the website.
auth.unlockDescription: Enter your master password to unlock your vault.
auth.logoutConfirm: Are you sure you want to logout?
auth.sessionExpired: Your session has expired. Please log in again.
auth.unlockSuccessDescription: You can now use autofill in login forms in your browser.

errors.invalidCode: Please enter a valid 6-digit authentication code.
errors.serverError: Could not reach AliasVault server. Please try again later or contact support if the problem persists.
errors.migrationError: An error occurred while checking for pending migrations.
errors.accountLocked: Account temporarily locked due to too many failed attempts.
errors.networkError: Network error. Please check your connection and try again.
errors.loginDataMissing: Login session expired. Please try again.

errors.VaultMergeRequired: Your vault needs to be updated. Please login on the AliasVault website and follow the steps.
errors.VaultOutdated: Your vault is outdated. Please login on the AliasVault website and follow the steps.
errors.NoVaultFound: Your account does not have a vault yet. Please complete the tutorial in the AliasVault web client before using the browser extension.
errors.serverNotAvailable: The AliasVault server is not available. Please try again later or contact support if the problem persists.
errors.clientVersionNotSupported: This version of the AliasVault browser extension is not supported by the server anymore. Please update your browser extension to the latest version.
errors.serverVersionNotSupported: The AliasVault server needs to be updated to a newer version in order to use this browser extension. Please contact support if you need help.
errors.failedToGetDefaultEmailDomain: Failed to get default email domain
errors.failedToGetDefaultIdentitySettings: Failed to get default identity settings
errors.noDerivedKeyAvailable: No derived key available for encryption
errors.failedToUploadVaultToServer: Failed to upload new vault to server
errors.noVaultOrDerivedKeyFound: No vault or derived key found

apiErrors.UNKNOWN_ERROR: An unknown error occurred. Please try again.
apiErrors.ACCOUNT_LOCKED: Account temporarily locked due to too many failed attempts. Please try again later.
apiErrors.ACCOUNT_BLOCKED: Your account has been disabled. If you believe this is a mistake, please contact support.
apiErrors.USER_NOT_FOUND: Invalid username or password. Please try again.
apiErrors.INVALID_AUTHENTICATOR_CODE: Invalid authenticator code. Please try again.
apiErrors.INVALID_RECOVERY_CODE: Invalid recovery code. Please try again.
apiErrors.PUBLIC_REGISTRATION_DISABLED: New account registration is currently disabled on this server. Please contact the administrator.
apiErrors.USERNAME_MISMATCH: Username does not match the current user.
apiErrors.PASSWORD_MISMATCH: The provided password does not match your current password.
apiErrors.USERNAME_EMPTY_OR_WHITESPACE: Username cannot be empty or whitespace.
apiErrors.USERNAME_TOO_SHORT: Username too short: must be at least 3 characters long.
apiErrors.USERNAME_TOO_LONG: Username too long: cannot be longer than 40 characters.
apiErrors.USERNAME_INVALID_CHARACTERS: Username is invalid, can only contain letters or digits.
apiErrors.VAULT_NOT_UP_TO_DATE: Your vault is not up-to-date. Please synchronize your vault and try again.
apiErrors.VAULT_ERROR: The local vault is not up-to-date. Please synchronize your vault by refreshing the page and try again.

content.randomIdentityDescription: Generate a random identity with a random email address accessible in AliasVault.
content.manualCredentialDescription: Specify your own email address and username.
content.failedToCreateIdentity: Failed to create identity. Please try again.

credentials.title: Credentials
credentials.noCredentialsDescription: Add your first credential to get started
credentials.welcomeDescription: To use the AliasVault browser extension: navigate to a website and use the AliasVault autofill popup to create a new credential.
credentials.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this credential?
credentials.deleteCredentialConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this credential? This action cannot be undone.

validation.invalidDateFormat: Date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format

emails.title: Emails
emails.deleteEmailConfirm: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this email?
emails.noEmailsDescription: You have not received any emails at your private email addresses yet. When you receive a new email, it will appear here.

errors.emailLoadError: An error occurred while loading emails. Please try again later.
errors.emailUnexpectedError: An unexpected error occurred while loading emails. Please try again later.

apiErrors.CLAIM_DOES_NOT_MATCH_USER: The current chosen email address is already in use. Please change the email address by editing this credential.
apiErrors.CLAIM_DOES_NOT_EXIST: An error occurred while trying to load the emails. Please try to edit and save the credential entry to synchronize the database, then try again.

settings.title: Settings
settings.activeOnAllSites: Active on all sites (unless disabled below)

validation.apiUrlInvalid: Please enter a valid API URL
validation.clientUrlInvalid: Please enter a valid client URL

upgrade.title: Upgrade Vault
upgrade.subtitle: AliasVault has updated and your vault needs to be upgraded. This should only take a few seconds.
upgrade.whatsNewDescription: An upgrade is required to support the following changes:
upgrade.noDescriptionAvailable: No description available for this version.

status.vaultAlreadyUpToDate: Vault is already up to date

alerts.unableToGetVersionInfo: Unable to get version information. Please try again.
alerts.selfHostedWarning: If you're using a self-hosted server, make sure to also update your self-hosted instance as otherwise logging in to the web client will stop working.
alerts.unknownErrorDuringUpgrade: An unknown error occurred during the upgrade. Please try again.
